Evaluation_Questions: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Comments_Questions: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
Comments_List: I was able to develop my understanding and comprehension of Italian. I realized that although this was a new and different challenge for me, through hard work I would eventually learn.  I also came to the realization that I knew more than I thought which helped my confidence.
More Italian tenses, moods, vocab, and greater comfortability speaking.
How to speak and write in Italian
Continued to improve skills learned in L1: grammar, vocab
Speaking, reading and writing in Italian
I learned about the Italian culture and continued to learn how to speak the language
I learned a lot more than just the basics of Italian. This semester, we focused on literature a lot.
I learned Italian grammatical structures and vocabulary that enhanced my fluency in the Italian language.
I gained a solid understanding of essential grammar concepts necessary to hold a conversation in Italian.
I improved my Italian vocabulary, grammar, and pronunciation.
Reading, writing, speaking, listening in italian. Good mix of grammar and vocab. Molto Bene!
This course was very student interactive which I considered a strength when learning a new language. It was nice to practice talking in Italian with other people who were at my speaking level.

Strengths- very immersive and understanding of mistakes 

Weaknesses- moves from concept to concept very quickly
Strengths- fun, interesting, I learned a lot
Excellent course
The class is fun and keeps you engaged while also teaching you a lot.
I would have preferred to deviate more from the textbook.

The course used the textbook really well which helped with studying and returning to examples a lot easier outside of class. Additionally, practice reading out loud and holding short conversations in Italian was really helpful for solidifying concepts. There were also fun things that engaged interests outside of Italian class like the presentations we did at the Yale Undergraduate Art Gallery.
Strengths were it is easy to get all the students involved. Weaknesses were I wish there was more speaking in the every day class.

Strengths- organization of the class, clear schedule, it was understood what we needed to know
Weaknesses- None!
I would recommend this course to anyone wanting to learn a new language as this is a course that makes it easier to learn.
If you want an engaging but nonetheless relaxed language, I highly recommend Italian, and especially Sarah Atkinson.
YES! The Italian department is amazing!!! It's a beautiful language and the professors really want you to enjoy learning it and excel.
Yes, because it is necessary to take a language and this is a rewarding way to do that
A good class to fulfill the language requirement, but not particularly engaging or interesting.
Yes it was a great class
Definitely
Yes, I would recommend this course to any student looking for a new language to start. Italian is fun to learn and fun to speak and useful when traveling to Europe!
I would recommend this course to another student because I feel the class covered a lot of ground.

I would recommend this course to another student because Italian is a beautiful language and the department is extremely helpful in providing the resources you need to succeed. The class was well organized and as long as you follow along with the textbook, you can figure out a lot of the concepts and practice to make sure you understand everything. You get a lot of feedback so you are constantly improving.

I absolutely would. The department and the teachers truly want the students to learn the language. This class makes me enjoy language once again, and really encourages me to experience the culture on my own.
Definitely. Italian is a beautiful language, and Professor Sarah Atkinson is awesome!
Yes! Amazing, intellectual and fun.
Yes!
